meanings.definition: In a manner that involves hard work or toil.
meanings.sent1: She worked moilingly in the fields under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers labored moilingly to finish the building on time.
meanings.sent3: The ants moved moilingly, trying to carry a large piece of food together.
meanings.sent4: Time passed moilingly as she struggled to solve the difficult puzzle.
meanings.sent5: He pushed the heavy cart moilingly up the steep hill.

meanings.definition: In a way that is busy or bustling.
meanings.sent1: The market was moilingly crowded with shoppers on the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were moilingly alive with people rushing to work.
meanings.sent3: The bees buzzed moilingly around the hive, collecting nectar.
meanings.sent4: The party was moilingly noisy with music and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The train station was moilingly busy with travelers coming and going.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is confused or chaotic.
meanings.sent1: The papers were scattered moilingly across the desk after the wind blew in.
meanings.sent2: The children ran moilingly around the playground, playing tag.
meanings.sent3: The birds flew moilingly in all directions when the cat appeared.
meanings.sent4: The thoughts raced moilingly through her mind during the exam.
meanings.sent5: The traffic moved moilingly through the intersection after the traffic lights malfunctioned.
